pros: None at this time.people are nice

pros: Okay benefits I guess. There are some good people here although they are hard to find. Difficult to get fired from even tho they point you for everything including having to take your child to the emergency room. There was also another instance where a coworker was pointed because she was coughing and management forced her to get a covid test done then pointed her for having to leave work due to being forced to take a covid test twice. She was negative for covid both times.
cons: Toxic workplace horrible management. Also if you want work life balance do not work here. The staff does nothing but cause drama between each other constantly. I was afraid to talk to anyone here but one person because they would smile to your face and then talk crap about you the second you leave. They bad mouthed the job, management and each other near constantly. The management is terrible and do not care for their employees in the slightest. They care about how you do your job but do not treat you like a person or an equal just a number while they sit in their offices all day everyday never helping out when it is needed or checking on their employees. They are mandating in the registration department now because they've had 6 people quit since I started in June. I took employment here based off of the terms that I was going on vacation August 21st to the 29th which was agreed upon when I accepted the position. They told me today I couldn't do my vacation anymore. Every day of training I wanted to rip my hair out because my coworkers were just horrible to deal with and listen to. The training was 8 weeks but I feel like I've learned the bare minimum. And on top of all that the benefits are garbage. You'd think a hospital would have better health insurance for their workers but nope. The pay is well below the nation average not only for my department but all of them.. Just all around a terrible job. Seek employment elsewhere.

review_title: Used to be a great company to work for but they are getting so big they no longer care about their employees.
pros: The employees at Bucyrus are a great group of people to work with and the ones I did work with at Galion were nice as well. The wage I made was pretty good for the area and my job description. One nice thing about their benefits is that you start accumulating PTO right away. In my position, for the most part, if I needed time off I could get it.
cons: Some of the management they have gotten in over the past few years do not have their employees best interest at heart.  They came from larger facilities, not a small "hometown" community and just don't treat people very well. There has been quite a turnover of employees at Avita over the last few years due to this management.  They have lost some very dedicated, hard-working and compassionate employees.

job_title: Tachnical Support Analyst in Galion, OH
pros: The work environment at least at the Galion Hospital is not frenzied, not stuffy, and behind the scenes fun. We are driven by patient satisfaction, opposed to volumes of rules and regulations dictating every patient interaction. While there are many different strengths, cultures, and values that people bring to the table in the organization, respect, cooperation, and happiness abound.
cons: Pay and the cost of benefits is average at best. If you are a Politically Correct, stuffy, dry, and/or humorless individual, this is not the right place for you to work.

job_title: Peripheral Vascular Lab Charge Nurse in Crestline, OH
pros: Great place to work. Love it! Leaving only because of relocating to different state. I have been there for more than 15 yrs. Excellent growing health system. I would recommend to anyone.
cons: The salary is comparable for the area but it is still a small community. I could drive 60 miles and increase my salary by $10,000-$20,000.
